title: Keen GBC enemies
content:
I have just made the Keen GBC enemies list. (I used small images as there are so many enemy types.) and it has come to my attention that several enemies are featured in both GBC and Keen 6 (Or even 4) The question is, how should the description of these enemies, (Which can be very different from the 'cannon' behaviours.) be done?

Should they have their own seperate articles, such as 'Shikadi' and 'Shikadi GBC'? Keeping them totally seperate from the Keen 4-6 descriptions and reachable only from the Keen GBC page,

Should they be added to the existing articles. (E.g. 'In Keen GBC Flect have reflecting plates on their chest instead...')

Should they simply be ignored and not written about?
[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v499/Nevad/menbun.gif[/img]

Cute bunny!

title: Re: Keen GBC enemies
content:
There'd probably be a bit of duplication if separate articles were used, so I suggest putting them in a separate section on the same page, for example:
[pre] The Shikadi are first seen in Keen 5.== Keen GBC ==The Shikadi also feature in the GBC episode.[/pre]
That way everything is on the same page (so someone searching for "Shikadi" doesn't need to specify GBC or not) yet the non-canon stuff is still separated in its own section.

title: Re: Keen GBC enemies
content:
I voted for the last option, but as it has been already decided that there'll be GBC, I think Malv's way sounds good. Perhaps there should be something template or whatever they are saying "Warning: This is Keen GBC info that isn't Keen canon, and likely messes up all the great ideas seen on the PC games! Don't take this seriously!".3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: Keen GBC enemies
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]"Warning: This is Keen GBC info that isn't Keen canon, and likely messes up all the great ideas seen on the PC games! Don't take this seriously!". [hr][/quote]
Both the content and purpose of a message like that is utterly bullshit and you know it!-----------------
[img]http://www.jamster.co.uk/s/jcw/img/logo_jamster_navi.gif[/img][img]http://www.jamster.co.uk/storage/view/335/0/cr/CrazyFrog___Axel_F_Falling.gif[/img]

title: Re: Keen GBC enemies
content:
You can get the official enemy descriptions from the GBC game (if you want them) from the scanned manual found on cc314: [url=http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/encyclopedia/info/mangbc/man12.html]www.classicgaming.com/cc3...man12.html[/url]--------------------
[url=http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/]Cerebral Cortex 314[/url] - For All of your Commander Keen Needs.
[url=http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/dave/joes.html]Eat at Joes[/url]

title: Re: Keen GBC enemies
content:
I'd say put them on separate articles, but have them linked. as the info varies between the games, its almost like having a separate character.

---Freeyorp

title: Re: Keen GBC enemies
content: But for the 'Mad Mushroom' article as an example, there's not much to say about that creature as is, so if we used separate pages there'd be a lot of articles with only a couple of lines of text in them.  If we could combine them and have the official image + info at the top, and then have the GBC image and other info under its own heading it would make each page look more complete.

title: Re: Keen GBC enemies
content:
I agree with Malv. That's pretty much what I was thinking.-Genius314
[url=http://planetck.spatang.com]PlanetCK[/url]

title: Re: Keen GBC enemies
content:
Agree, they work the same on the original wiki so why shouldn't we?-----------------

title: Re: Keen GBC enemies
content:
That sounds good to me! The public have voted. (Let us hope there is no sabotage like on wikipaedia.)

I am not going to put more pictures up though, it takes all my time.

Cute bunny!

title: Re: Keen GBC enemies
content:
I can assure you I will not hesitate to ban anyone vandalising the wiki, so don't worry about that [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smoke.gif[/img]

And yes, uploading images does take a lot of effort, but the beauty of a wiki is that you can take a break for a while and have someone else do the hard work (go Memsys!)

title: Re: Keen GBC enemies
content:
The problem with determined people is they can always get new accounts and do more damage, we're lucky we haven't had anyone here who's come back over and over and over to insult and ruin the community, but those people do exist.

title: Re: Keen GBC enemies
content: The difference is you have to create an account on the KeenWiki before you can edit, and if someone keeps coming back after being banned I'll just moderate the new accounts and be careful which requests I approve.  At the very least it will slow down the vandalism...

title: Less
content: The 'less is more' approach to defending content?

title: Re: Less
content:
I'm sure every Keener who wants to join will be accepted, at least if his/her reputation is clean.

In this kind of wiki watching closely the ones who register (so they aren't spam bots) prevents a lot. Naturally some malicious human can register with some other Keener's name or whatever, but luckily the damage is always reversible (at least unless he/she gets to destroy the database).

Anyways, I don't think there's been any vandalism yet.3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."
